title: Understanding Encryption
text: Encryption is a process that converts information or data into a code, especially to prevent unauthorized access. It's a key method for protecting sensitive information online.

title: Why Not Public Wi-Fi?
text: Public Wi-Fi is often unsecured, making it a risky choice for transmitting sensitive information. It does not protect data but rather exposes it to potential threats.

title: Open Source Software
text: While open source software can be secure, it is not inherently a method for protecting sensitive information. It refers to software with source code that anyone can inspect, modify, and enhance.

title: Social Media Sharing
text: Sharing on social media is not a method for protecting information. In fact, it can lead to the exposure of sensitive data if not managed carefully.

title: Choosing the Right Method
text: Among the options, which one is specifically designed to protect sensitive information online?
